text: Hyphessobrycon brumado is a species of tetra fish belonging to the family characidae, inhabiting South American river of Rio Brumado and the Rio de Contas drainage. ==Description== Hyphessobrycon brumado is a long, slender fish, similar to many of its kin. Its body is yellow-orange in color and has a blurred black stripe running down its lateral line. This stripe thickens and becomes less blurred at the tail; more apparent on males. ==References== Category:Characidae Category:Tetras Category:Fish described in 2010
title: Hyphessobrycon brumado
